agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: State Affairs TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E2.014 CHAIR: Rep. Dade Phelan *****ALL TESTIMONY WILL BE LIMITED TO 2 MINUTES***** HB 35 Romero, Jr. | et al. Relating to the creation of a Texas conditional driver's permit, provisional Texas conditional driver's permit, and Texas conditional instruction permit; authorizing a fee. HB 112 Swanson Relating to legislative review and approval of certain state agency rules. HB 168 Canales Relating to a study on the creation of bilingual zones in certain areas of this state. HB 244 Farrar | et al. Relating to the prohibition of certain discrimination based on sexual orientation or gender identity or expression; providing an administrative penalty; creating a criminal offense. HB 328 Ortega Relating to authorization for a county or municipality to establish a local minimum wage. HB 445 González, Mary Relating to exceptions from the requirement for a person under the direction or control of a local entity or campus police department to assist or cooperate with federal immigration officers. HB 652 Neave | et al. Relating to an exception from requirements to assist or cooperate with federal immigration officers for matters regarding activities that occur at a domestic violence shelter. HB 761 Wu Relating to the establishment of the Texas Pay Equity Task Force. HB 1035 Zedler | et al. Relating to protecting freedom of conscience from government discrimination. HB 1041 Walle Relating to the places a public employer may provide for employees to express breast milk. HB 1183 Johnson, Jarvis Relating to abolishing Confederate Heroes Day. HB 1347 Bell, Cecil | et al. Relating to the Texas Sovereignty Act. HB 2266 Anchia Relating to the repeal of certain provisions governing state and local enforcement of immigration laws and other provisions related to immigration law. HB 2434 Schaefer | et al. Relating to information regarding perinatal palliative care and prohibiting discriminatory abortions; creating an administrative penalty, a civil remedy, and a criminal offense. HB 2677 Goldman Relating to prohibiting certain expenditures from political contributions. HB 2743 Neave Relating to an annual workplace climate survey conducted by state agencies. HB 3172 Krause Relating to the protection of religious beliefs and moral convictions, including beliefs and convictions regarding marriage. HB 3349 Bucy Relating to certain drug tests administered to employees and independent contractors of state agencies and political subdivisions. HB 3811 Martinez Fischer Relating to the enforcement by certain local governmental entities and campus police departments of state and federal laws governing immigration. HB 3813 Martinez Fischer Relating to the removal from office of a public officer of a political subdivision for policies or actions regarding immigration enforcement. HB 3907 Moody Relating to use of the electronic funds transfer system operated by the comptroller. HB 4001 Nevárez Relating to the issuance of a permit by the Public Utility Commission of Texas for the routing of certain oil or gas pipelines; authorizing administrative penalties. HB 4041 Toth Relating to prohibiting the enforcement of certain federal laws; creating a criminal offense. HB 4210 Johnson, Eric Relating to publication of notice requirements for certain governmental entities and representatives. HB 4288 Morrison Relating to use of a program manager for certain public works projects. HB 4554 Cyrier Relating to the parks and wildlife commission's authority to designate wind-powered energy device construction areas near certain lands. HB 4623 Meyer Relating to a prohibition against the creation of a fund and the use of state money by a state elected official or a state elected official's staff to settle or pay a sexual harassment claim made against a state elected official or the state elected official's staff. HCR 17 Stephenson | et al. Supporting prayers, including the use of the word "God," at public gatherings and displays of the Ten Commandments in public educational institutions and other government buildings. HJR 98 Biedermann Proposing a constitutional amendment to limit the time that a person may serve as a member of the Texas Legislature or as a statewide elected officer in the executive branch. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
